meanings.definition: To obtain the release of (a captive) by paying a ransom.
meanings.sent1: The brave knight was ransoming the princess from the evil dragon.
meanings.sent2: The family decided to try ransoming their stolen pet back from the thieves.
meanings.sent3: The clever spy was caught ransoming a fake treasure map for a bag of candy.
meanings.sent4: In the negotiation, the diplomat skillfully used ransoming as a bargaining chip.
meanings.sent5: The idea of ransoming the lost treasure for a magical key seemed like a risky adventure.

meanings.definition: The action of paying a sum of money for the release of a prisoner.
meanings.sent1: The community came together to collect funds for the ransoming of the wrongly accused man.
meanings.sent2: The history books were filled with tales of brave acts of ransoming throughout the centuries.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show featured a hilarious skit about a mix-up in a ransoming attempt.
meanings.sent4: The concept of ransoming a secret for a favor was a common theme in the spy novel.
meanings.sent5: The movie portrayed the emotional turmoil of a family facing the dilemma of ransoming their loved one.
